info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 10:36PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN HARRISON...NORTHERN JEFFERSON...SOUTHEASTERN COLUMBIANA...SOUTHEASTERN CARROLL... SOUTHWESTERN BEAVER...NORTHWESTERN WASHINGTON...WESTERN ALLEGHENY... BROOKE AND HANCOCK COUNTIES THROUGH 1115 PM EDT... At 1036 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles west of Wellsville to 10 miles west of New Cumberland to 12 miles northwest of Wintersville. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Weirton, Steubenville, East Liverpool, Wellsville, Toronto, Calcutta, Wintersville, Ohioville, Follansbee, Midland, Chester, and Industry. This includes Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 40 and 45. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
